column5: What are the best fly in out post camps in this price range$1500 in the Sioux look out or red lake or Nestor falls area for big walleye and pike thanks again guy's

I'd spend a week on Little Vermilion for huge pike and great numbers of small to medium walleyes. I'd spend a week on Nungesser for good numbers of big walleyes and some nice pike. I suggest going now to check it out for a return trip in 2011.That's exactly what I was planning to do, today, until I went to my doc for a third cortisone injection for an ailing shoulder. I got an MRI instead and will have surgery September 14. Doc says I need it now.
Wow, you have my sympathy, there is hardly anything worse (other than family situations) than missing a trip north you have been looking forward to. Bill Krejca

Thanks Bill. I've probably had my share of fishing trips, but it still hurts to miss one now and then. Spending a few months thinking of my next one will make my life better. I'll be at the head of my class in rehab.
How about Nester falls out post camps fly in ???
Todd and Jake at Atikwa Lake Lodge are very good friends of mine. They have 8 or more lakes to fish... very reasonably priced!
